availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas N. Perry (Morgan County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, merchant. Morgan County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas D. Perry and Martha Wells Perry. Married to Elizabeth A. McCormick Perry in Morgan County, Kentucky, on October 3, 1855. Father of Emma and Benjamin F. Perry. Attended school in Morgan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Morgan County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Morgan County in 1850. Merchant in Morgan County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Morgan County in 1860.

"Aged Kentuckian Dies," The Cincinnati Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), October 8, 1924, p. 18.
